website_summaries.verdict: The Canon PowerShot S100 is a generally great little camera for advanced shooters who don't mind slowing down a bit from a dSLR.
pros: A great little camera with advanced features, the Canon PowerShot S100 builds on the strengths of its excellent predecessor
cons: As a trade-off for extending the zoom range to 5x the lens' aperture narrows very quickly as you zoom out
And there's no improvement over the S95's so-so performance, despite the price increase

customer_reviews.title: Canon Repairs unavailable
customer_reviews.text: Good travel camera, but alas, during an important trip I discovered that the display was damaged (ie the image displayed had noise artifacts with about 1/4 of the view usable. I wanted to have this repaired as it still seems to function otherwise, but the Canon web site stated there are no repairs for this model (7 years old).
customer_reviews.author: Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Great camera to take along anywhere.  Buy STK batteries as well instead of other generic or Canon batteries.
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp. Great manual controls. Great features. Great ergonomics. Very compact as well. I think that this is one of the best compact camera with manual controls. Only downside is that it eats up battery charge fast. Canon batteries are very expensive. I tried using the generic ones but they do not last long except STK batteries. Those are awesome and lasts for a very long time. It probably lasts longer than the original Canon batteries. If you buy those batteries then you got the perfect compact point and shoot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Video Shortcoming
customer_reviews.text: Several excellent comprehensive reviews have already been posted on the S100. I did want to point out one shortcoming: in video mode, the sound of the lens autofocusing is recorded. You will hear the rapid fire clicking noise of the auto focus motor several times per second upon playback during quiet scenes. The sound is subtle but noticeable during quiet scenes. The sound is not noticeable while people are talking, or music is playing, or there is background noise. Whether or not you can live with the autofocus motor noise is strictly a matter of personal preference. It is not a deal killer for what is otherwise a very nifty little camera.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth A. Attorri

customer_reviews.title: Camera died in 18 months
customer_reviews.text: Camera has a message "“Lens Error. Will Shut Down Automatically. Restart Camera “ and the lens will not retract. Camera is totally non-functional after only 18 months of use. The exact problem is posted on Canon's website as a product advisory but our serial numbers are not within the range for free repair. Sent the camera to their service center and they will repair for $160. Spoke with a representative at the repair center who had no apologies or explanations. Obviously we decided to put that cost towards a new camera which will definitely not be a Canon product. Very poor customer service.
customer_reviews.author: Donna D

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for concert recording in high definition and stereo
customer_reviews.text: Canon PowerShot S100 has excellent low-light performance. It records stereo (left and right channels) sounds (out of the box) without the hassle of plugging in an external mic. The noise from the zooming mechanism is not a problem in a concert setting. Even with Power IS turned off, the camera shake is acceptable and actually gives YouTube very good clues for its 3-D conversion. I am very happy with the results  I am particularly impressed by the reproduction of the subtle depth of the performer's facial features in the YouTube 3-D HD mode. For best results, always carry an extra battery and hold the camera correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Isaac Cheng

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot.
customer_reviews.text: I say that because of the GPS function, otherwise I would have purchased the S110. Super slo-mo is great, however, it does only work with very bright light. The camera has many functions, and takes incredibly clear pictures. The glass is very good, just what you would expect from Canon. Picture quality is close to the Nikon 700, but it is portable enough to take everywhere. I would also recommend the 'Eynpire Camera Leather Case For Canon S100'. Nice case, classic style, better functionality than a nylon zippered case. My only wish is that someone would come up with a reasonably priced underwater case for this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Lone Biker of the Apacolypse

customer_reviews.title: Lens Error Problem
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this camera for almost two years. Today is the second time I have gotten a "Lens Error". The first time happened when it was less than a month old. The lens stuck open on Chri camstmas eve. It cost over $100 to repair. Now it has happened again. This is a known defect that canon actually fixed for free but I never knew about the repair program, I was not notified.Canon wants over $170 to fix it. My (once) $400.00 camera now is up to almost $700. Not worth it! It did a good job as a point and shoot camera and I bought it because it shoot RAW format.
customer_reviews.author: DavidA

customer_reviews.title: S100 is OK
customer_reviews.text: I have a Canon G9 and the quality of the photographs from the S100 are not nearly as good as the G9. Its sensor is superior to the G9 though. I sent the G9 back to Canon to correct gray spots on the photographs. The spots have returned. In the S100 it appears that Canon has corrected the problem. I often take strongly backlit photos and the S100 is great for this. The parallax distortion on the S100 is problematic when you dont hold the camera exactly perpendicular to the plane of the photograph. Fortunately I can correct most of the problems with GIMP2.
customer_reviews.author: Gandalf

customer_reviews.title: Too much shutter lag
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera to use as a secondary camera for my DSLR because of it's compact size. My intended purpose is to use it during small family gatherings, dine-outs, etc where carrying a DLSR could be cumbersome and where the average cell phone cameras has limitations with low light performance. The image quality is good, but not great. But my main gripe is the lack of Speed,in Auto focus and the shutter lag. I miss too many shots because of the shutter lag, especially if you use flash. The AF speed is also quite slow. In this aspect it can't even beat the cell phone cameras. I am disappointed with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Skywalker

customer_reviews.title: Good, for a compact.  Flash broken.
customer_reviews.text: Good, compact camera. Good pictures in low light, but only with wide angle photos (i.e. no zoom). No ability to control depth of field (the entire frame is always in focus) which is not good for portraits -- but hey, that's what you get with a compact camera. The flash mechanism broke early on -- my hand blocked it as it tried to extend -- and now it doesn't work. It's not reparable! Fortunately I rarely use the flash so the camera still has value for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Robinson

customer_reviews.title: Canon repair service is terrible
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this camera in April 2017. One year and nine months later the lens won't retract and the camera is inoperable. Reset doesn't help. Canon will not provide repair service, saying they no longer have parts, and they suggest I buy the $800 replacement, offering me a $20 discount! Buy Canon products at your own risk. I've had enough.
customer_reviews.author: macpfister

customer_reviews.title: Great little camera with one major flaw- a focusing noise ...
customer_reviews.text: Great little camera with one major flaw- a focusing noise during and in video recordings. It's great that the camera has continuous auto focus, but the downside is the noise that it makes to the recording. It has manual focus to alleviate this, but one can't change a focus range during video recording. Manual focus only works as a fixed range. Raw pictures are good and it's a nice wide angle. I got it for a good deal!
customer_reviews.author: Quoc Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: No regrets
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a trip to Germany's Christmas markets, and headed overseas without having used the new camera, so it was a learn-on-the-vacation experience. I didn't even know where the zoom button was (it's perfectly obvious, of course) or how to view my pictures (which I learned a few days into the trip). I'd been relying on my smartphone to take pictures for years, and was pleasantly surprised to see how much better the photos from a dedicated camera are. So my impulse purchase from the Deal of the Day really did turn out to be a "good deal," although I'll confess that I still haven't worked my way through the manual or used all the camera features.
customer_reviews.author: nighthawk

customer_reviews.title: My fifth S-series powershot
customer_reviews.text: I've decided that the camera that takes the best pictures is the one you have with you and I just got tired of trudging around with a camera bag filled with lenses, spare back, batteries, flash units, filters, etc. I use a 3rd party filter adapter and I can pocket this camera and a couple of filters and still have full creative control wherever I go. The unit has excellent low light performance. With a single 16G card, I shot hundreds of pictures in RAW + JPEG and still had half the card free after a two week vacation in Italy.
customer_reviews.author: Toyman

customer_reviews.title: Great, Portable Camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a DSLR, which I love, but sometimes I don't want to carry my big camera and big lenses. Sometimes I just want to have a camera with me just in case something interesting pops up. This S100 is exceeding my expectations. I decided on this camera because I still wanted to shoot RAW and have the ability to process the images. The RAW images are beautiful. I've heard, "The best camera is the one you're carrying." This little gem goes with me all the time, even when I have my DSLR.
customer_reviews.author: Chris McNaught

customer_reviews.title: WHy I love my Canon  Power shot 100 camera
customer_reviews.text: Our Camera club is over 100 strong with photographers of every level and most of us have purchased a small, quick to access camera to suppplement our larger, regular equipment. I chose this camera bcause I searched for the camera of this size with "the best optics" and was advised that this was the one. I have been very pleased with the results that I get and the sharp accuracy and complete utility of the zoom lens it contains. I have had smaller units before but they were not neraly as good as this one. All of its features deliver the advertised results (FOR ME) and I recommend it highlty
customer_reviews.author: Cliff Kelly

customer_reviews.title: great pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: When it first came out, I bought the S95, which I still have and use for work. But then Canon announced the S100 and I wanted it for the wider and longer lens and newer image processor. Then came the S110, which to me was not an improvement. I saw one in the store and it looked cheap. So I grabbed an S100 for $279. I've taken it to New Zealand on vacation and was more than pleased with the pictures it got. I also had my Lumix DMC-GX1 with 3 lenses, but within its zoom range, the S100 was just as good.
customer_reviews.author: MrKen

customer_reviews.title: Fast snap, easy interface, great shots!
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd Canon digital camera in 9 years. Is that a knock or endorsement that I keep coming back to the same well? ENDORSEMENT!!!! We have kids and an active lifestyle. It's amazing that our cameras last as long as they do! When you want a dead simple, straight forward, pocket sized point & shoot, look no further. Each new model brings better resolution, battery life, and speed. My wife and I both have iPhones with decent cameras but they don't compare to a dedicated 12+MP camera.
customer_reviews.author: mwalsh23

customer_reviews.title: Shutter Failed
customer_reviews.text: OK - I'll admit this camera takes great pictures and videos; however I purchased it less than two years ago - shutter stopped working completely. See the Canon forums for more information - lots of people reporting the same problem. Canon is charging 60% of the current price to fix it. I have used Nikon, Panasonic and Sony pocket cameras for years and for the couple problems I've had, both times the manufacturer stood behind their product and fixed it for shipping cost. I'll never buy another Canon product!
customer_reviews.author: John S. Morris

customer_reviews.title: good camera, but has some issues
customer_reviews.text: camera is great - I like the extra lens ring and the image quality is top-notch. quality of the camera itself is great, the matted black is great and a lot of people have made comments on this. but it is annoying for most people - mainly because of the flash. The flash pops up right where most people put their finger...I don't mind it myself, but when I give it to other people, it is always a hassle. It is annoying have to tell people to put their finger somewhere else, especially when you need flash. Got this for $250, which is fair price, but could not deal with the flash.
customer_reviews.author: hxh

customer_reviews.title: unreliable flawed design
customer_reviews.text: Lasted 5 months before it developed the infamous "lens error". Was sent in for repair at no cost (under warranty) and then it worked well for about a year. Broke again last week while on vacation due to reappearance of the "lens error". The error occurs during normal operation and is clearly a design defect. Very inconvenient to not have a camera on vacation. Canon wants $160 to repair, too much IMO for a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing camera. Solid build and great photos. I have taken about 800 photos so far and almost all of them are keepers. I am still going through the 200 plus page manual and learning new things all the time on what more this can do. Incredible features and quality, I am super impressed. Overall reviews are lower because of the lens error but I got this at a price I felt was worth the risk. My serial number is outside the range of those with the issues so hopefully this will give me years of service. Couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: T. J.

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: It was the top rated low-light compact camera on a few websites, and it totally holds up to that. It takes really nice pictures in dark bars without a flash. A few times now I've had people insist that the picture won't come out, and then I show it to them and they are thusly schooled. It has a lot of amazing and fun settings, it fits in my purse, and everything is great quality for the price point. I absolutely adore this camera, and if you stand still long enough I'll explain that to you at every opportunity.
customer_reviews.author: C E Reid

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera for the Price
customer_reviews.text: Canon photos tend to push the color saturation a little but most people enjoy the depth of the color. Though the focusing has some issues but not enough to complain about. It's not all that great with low lighting and the Auto Focus does a lousy job of it. If there is one thing that I would discourage this product is it's hit and miss focusing ability in low light. If you want a really great camera than you would need to save up for a pro DSLR camera. I will the next time around...
customer_reviews.author: Da Man

customer_reviews.title: Not Worth the Money and Headaches!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera in December 2011, and the photos were very good when it worked. The lens mechanism failed in June 2013 after just 18 months of careful use. Canon repaired it under warranty. It failed again in November 2014 with the same problem, after another 17 months of use. This time Canon wanted $174 to fix it - almost half the original price. Only three years of service with two major lens failures that have been documented by many other owners is unacceptable for a camera that cost $400. To be sure, its replacement will be made by a manufacturer other than Canon.
customer_reviews.author: Dave U

customer_reviews.title: Great camera!
customer_reviews.text: I have had 2 Canon "S" Series cameras (S 50 and S 100) and both take great pictures. I use the continuous shooting feature with my grand daughter and almost always get one or two great shots for each scene I attempt. I had several other brands of cameras between my S 50 and S 100 and was never really happy with them. I wish I had repaired my S 50 when the LCD became faulty after a couple of years of use. I would highly recommend the S 100.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Moore

customer_reviews.title: I love this camera.
customer_reviews.text: I carry this with my Nikon d5100. I use both. I love that it shoots raw and I sometimes set it on aeb for 3 shots that I process in Photomatix for HDR pictures. It frees me up for getting a lot of different shots. I like the neutral density filter for water shots. It's so handy and small that it lays on my desk. It fits right in my pocket too. They have a long way to go if they are going to replace this camera with a phone camera. Get the gorilla pod for it too. Very handy.
customer_reviews.author: Kiki

customer_reviews.title: Love this point and shoot that shoots RAW
customer_reviews.text: I love shooting RAW on ms DSLR and was so happy to buy this as a smaller, RAW-shooting alternative. This camera takes high quality photos considering its size, and the ability to edit the RAW files afterward was the selling point for me. I've taken this camera on my special trips and vacations and it always works like a charm. Even without editing the colors are vibrant, the photos are crisp, and the focus is great.
customer_reviews.author: Kristy G.

customer_reviews.title: Lens Jam - Invest in Quality Case
customer_reviews.text: I loved it to pieces but the lens jammed while I was travelling and having it repaired would be as much as the camera itself. -_- Apparently, this is a common issue, but the picture and color quality was great.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great camera for those times when you don't want to take along a DSLR
customer_reviews.text: amazing camera for times when you don't want to lug around a DSLR. I purchased this camera so that I could keep it in my backpack at work to take photos on short notice. i typically carry around a DSLR, but this is nice in a pinch. It shoots raw images and the quality is amazing. I really, really like the fact that I have the ability to do manual settings and can use the control ring to focus or zoom or any number of other functions.
customer_reviews.author: K. Stigler

customer_reviews.title: Excellent photo quality
customer_reviews.text: Great photos from a compact camera. Many capabilities beyond my photographic skill! So easy to slip into a bag or backpack and always have with you. Took it on safari in South Africa and captured photos every bit as good as my husband's Canon Rebel.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great camera!
customer_reviews.text: Small and light but has tons of options like my big camera. Love that you can control apperture, iso, white balance, even the flash brightness can be made stronger or dimmer. There is much more you can customize. Best camera I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: Kathleen B. Castrigno

customer_reviews.title: Lens Error
customer_reviews.text: Camera was bought in May 2012, and the serial number is above the listed numbers by Canon, still I've got Lens Error, and lens is stuck. Quality of low light pictures are great, camera is great in use, easy, portable, but 50/50 it will break up in the first few month of using without any harsh conditions (I was making picture of flower). Sending camera for repair to Canon Service. Update: It broke again.
customer_reviews.author: A. kaunator

customer_reviews.title: Simply a terrific camera
customer_reviews.text: I am a serious camera user but not a professional. I will keep this short, since so many have posted better than I ever will, with specs, comparisons, etc. All I can say is this -- I have owed about eight Canon cameras, both digital Elphs and semi-pro S cameras. This is the best. Best digital I've owned. Fits in a pocket, great lenses, can go manual, takes great shots. That is all. I think I will buy one more.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynBen

customer_reviews.title: Had it for about a month now...
customer_reviews.text: Got my camera and it works perfectly and is a very solid build. Haven't had the lens error that other reviewers mentioned. I had to get a 32GB SD card because the one I had (1GB) was getting filled up pretty fast with the HD video. The microphone for the video is very good. The picture view has on-screen histograms - RGB and luminosity! The battery lasts a long time and the wall-unit recharger is much more convenient than AA batteries all the time. The manual is very comprehensive. I haven't noticed the GPS working yet, but maybe that's because it doesn't locate inside buildings? I'm pleased with the purchase and would buy again and have recommended to friends already!
customer_reviews.author: Anthony Deal

customer_reviews.title: Nice upgrade
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this as a gift to replace an older non-S canon camera. Not quite as slim as the older Canon that it replaced but still slim enough to be pocketable. Picture quality is far superior and achieves the low light quality that the gift receiver was looking for. Battery life is not terribly great but that is to be expected especially with the large display screen. A second battery is highly recommended. However, I noticed that Canon did change the battery on this camera, so using batteries from previous models might not be an option (i.e. I personally own the original S90 and the battery from that model is different).
customer_reviews.author: Wrekreation

customer_reviews.title: Nice small camera, powerful
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a camera that is small and fits into my pocket but at the same time has some power. This camera has many features and takes very nice pictures. This is a great day to day camera for taking casual pictures and kids activities. However if you want to take serious action pictures, you still need to move up to one of the canon larger cameras.
customer_reviews.author: Yazdiary

customer_reviews.title: Canon PowerShot S100 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this Canon PowerShot S100 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide-Angle Optical to use when on the occasions when I prefer not to take all my heavier DSLR cameras and gear with me when traveling. This is literally a pocket sized camera that fits nicely in a shirt pocket. But don't let it's size fool you. It is a sophisticated camera that shoots RAW as well as JPEG format and takes very fine pictures. I recommend it highly.
customer_reviews.author: Riverrunner7

customer_reviews.title: Great compact digital
customer_reviews.text: I am a serious photographer with some high end Nikon digital cameras and lenses. But I like to have a compact digital camera in my pocket. This is my fifth compact digital... and absolutely the best compact digital I have worked with. Can be used from fully auto mode to fully manual mode with very good image results. Can not beat this camera unless you go for a model priced over $ 1,000. The ratio of Megapixels to image sensor size is one of the reasons I chose this model.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck_R

customer_reviews.title: CANON, no longer the leader in quality.
customer_reviews.text: Problem after problem and Canon is terrible these days on support. have been a fan of canon since 1980 when I got my first A1. Expected alot form this little guy and was disappointed after the first month. Internal mechanical issues and electronic poblems. Canon would fix for the cost of getting another one at about 2/3rds cost. After 2nd repair i said quits to CANON and wont look at another of their cameras.
customer_reviews.author: jonathon

customer_reviews.title: Impressed every time I take a picture.
customer_reviews.text: I got this camera after selling a bulky Nikon DSLR. I wanted something with good picture quality and pocket-sized. I have to say that I am impressed by every photo. My husband and I will take a photo, glance down at the preview and just say, "Wow". The photos are bright and crisp. The camera itself feels great to hold, feels expensive and works great. I am so glad I got this camera, its perfect for us.
customer_reviews.author: Amy and Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Love, Love, Love This Camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera is light-years ahead of the one we had for the past 5 years. If you haven't purchased a new point-and-shoot in the past few years, don't even think about spending more money until you try this one out. Indoor low-light performance was important to me and I was not disappointed. Auto is not always the best, so learn about some of the modes that best suit the conditions you find yourself in the most often. Couldn't be happier for the price.
customer_reviews.author: AC

customer_reviews.title: Canon S100 high quality pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: This camera has great low light capability - oversized 12 MB CMOS sensor and f2.0 lens allow you to get acceptable results at ISO 3200. The 3 " screen is bright and the controls are similar to most Canon pocket cameras. The 5x zoom has the 35 mm equivalent of ~ 24mm to 120 mm. Pictures look great.
customer_reviews.author: tom

customer_reviews.title: Has focusing issues
customer_reviews.text: This camera (serial # starts with 47xx) worked great for five months but now has focus issues. If I zoom out and zoom back in, the camera can no longer focus. I have to turn the camera off and then back on to get back in focus. But once I zoom out and back in, same issue; camera cannot focus and takes blurry pictures. I even updated to the latest firmware, still same issue. When it worked, it took great pictures. Seems like a design or quality issue. If I could do it over again, I would not buy this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best point and shoot I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: I got tired of carrying around a DSLR on vacation in order to use manual functions easily. This camera has performed so well that I've actually stopped using my DLSR (Nikon D5000) for a lot of things. This camera is great in low light, and I love the "clicky wheel" on the front. A quality product, I couldn't be happier with this camera.
customer_reviews.author: JRC

customer_reviews.title: Incredible
customer_reviews.text: Incredible point and shoot camera. The price here compared to other sites like best buy and newegg can't be beat. Pros: -Pictures are clear and look amazing. Even in high or low lighting. -HD video recording. -I like the ability to manuall control the ISO. -The butons and overall fell of the camera is great. I like the way it feels in my hands. Cons: -So far just the battery life. -You need to buy a second battery.
customer_reviews.author: Peeps

customer_reviews.title: Perfect compact camera
customer_reviews.text: This has the same sensor and full manual features of the larger G line. It can save photos in RAW format and balance a fill flash. One of my favorite features is the timer more that lets you shoot 10 shots at a time, so you don't have to keep running back and forth to the camera. All this in a pocket sized camera, makes it amazing.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kincaid

customer_reviews.title: Canon is my favorite.
customer_reviews.text: This is the third PowerShot camera I've owned. I travel allot so being able to put it in my pocket makes it always available. It is very easy to use and takes quality pictures. I have cataloged thousands of pics with my Canons and most are clear, sharp and the colors are true to life. I recommend this camera to anyone that wants good pictures that don't require great skill to take.
customer_reviews.author: Rico

customer_reviews.title: Uh Huh, Uh Huh, It's All Shook Up!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera because it had the dreaded "lens error" and didn't work. Luckily, I have a high understanding of all things hammer related and proceeded to beat it until it worked again. I am sure the dents will rub out. ;-) I had to order parts to repair it and had to wait a while but the camera once fixed is outstanding. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: The Building Guy

customer_reviews.title: Great value
customer_reviews.text: I had to get used to not having a viewfinder, not gripping the top left corner (where the flash pops up), and the GPS can take awhile to get the position locked, but overall I'm happy with the performance and quality of photos as well as the build of the camera. Having the photos geo-tagged is really convenient, and its fun making slow-motion videos. 1080p HD videos can be memory hungry (a 7min video used 900MB). Videos and flash also use up the battery quickly, so I'd recommend getting at least a 16GB class 10 memory card and a 2nd battery to make sure you get though the day.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Kish

customer_reviews.title: It takes very good pictures, and didn't realize the quality value (compared ...
customer_reviews.text: After testing other cameras, without satisfaction, I purchased this camera, for the second time. It takes very good pictures, and didn't realize the quality value (compared to other Cannon point-shoot cameras). The only thing, which probably can't be avoided in this price range camera ---takes a couple seconds to snap the picture is very dim lighting. Holding the camera stable, it is still a good pictures, and tweak and adjust all my photos, when I download for keeping. Others compliment me on my photos...and I attribute it to this camera. Get it, recommended!!
customer_reviews.author: S. K.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent small size camera.with advanced settings
customer_reviews.text: Amazing little camera! Gives great control, with most manual settings one would expect from a much larger camera. Hard to tell it is not a full-fledged dslr when just looking at picture. Excellent price-point, practically small size conducive to carrying this when traveling, enough advanced settings to keep everyone engaged, even more advanced photographers. Even the camcorder function gives good quality 1080p video! In short this item will not disappoint.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Never leave home without it
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little camera. When I don't want to haul around my DSLR this little thing is a great alternative. It may not do the heavy lifting of the big boys but returns some surprisingly clear shots. Limited aperture control, especially at higher zoom, would be my only complaint. But for the price I shouldn't complain.
customer_reviews.author: David D

customer_reviews.title: Good carry-around camera
customer_reviews.text: It's nice and compact, it has a wide-angle zoom reaching out to mild tele, the lens is reasonably fast, it can record in raw and it is now quite reasonably priced. I wish it had a viewfinder like one of its predecessors had (S70?). While it was far from a great viewfinder, at least it allowed you to point the camera in bright sunlight. The screen on the S100 is not useable in bright sun.
customer_reviews.author: PeterB37

customer_reviews.title: Decent pocket camera
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this as a portable replacement for a dSLR a year ago and it has held up well. I love that it has manual adjustments and a RAW image option. I think the battery life is great. Movies shot with this camera are sharp and the sound is quite good. The only thing I'm not crazy about is that in the auto mode the colors can be a bit washed out.
customer_reviews.author: Dagny

customer_reviews.title: I love it but fails !!!
customer_reviews.text: It is a wonderfull camera - IDEA- , but 2 bugs are present. 1a"I have not had good results with this setting (AWB) shooting indoors under incandescent lighting ...." this note become from "photographers guide to the canon powershot S100 " it makes your photo appear blue (ish) 2a suddenly the lens dont retract any more when turn off the camera... you can read on it in canon webpage... it is a pity because is a fenomenal camera ... if it works properly .
customer_reviews.author: JULIAN E

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this camera just prior to going to Paris. It did fabulous. The pictures came out clear and beautiful. Many of the museums require NO FLASH. This camera took great pictures in those situations. I couldn't be more pleased with how easy it was to use and the quality of the pictures and videos. I would recommend it to any one.
customer_reviews.author: PAE

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera!
customer_reviews.text: Compact, powerful and gives a good shot every time. I had the S95 and upgraded to the S100 -- not much difference in the menu options, but still...the camera definitely does not disappoint. Quick shutter speeds, great videos, pics are crisp. Takes a little bit to walk through the menu to understand all the available settings, but that's a one-time learning curve.
customer_reviews.author: Ilona

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera
customer_reviews.text: Perfect videos, great shots, point and shoot perfect, using the program settings perfect. Shots are clear and perfect. Girl Friend has camera at work to shoot products. easier to use then her $1,500 slr, and shots are good enough for Her products. I really like this camera, so does my Girl friend, I guess I should consider buying another one
customer_reviews.author: Iron Thunder

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I've owned this for 4+ years now. It's a great all around camera that takes high quality pictures, has great focus capabilities, and comes close to mimicking some nice SLR features. It has traveled throughout Europe and the US and has served my family well. The only complaint I have is that it has trouble capturing decent photos in low light situations indoors without the flash no matter how much I try to tweak.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Lancaster

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome camera for its size. It is the second one I've owned...the first 'took a swim.'
customer_reviews.author: M. Franz

customer_reviews.title: 2 years old and still chugging (after several drops)
customer_reviews.text: this camera will work as a party camera, serious moment camera, video camera, an everyday life camera for those still think their iPhones camera just doesn't cut it for every scenario. (maybe the iPhone 6 will kill this product). I highly recommend. Shoots RAW, that's the best part.
customer_reviews.author: AA

customer_reviews.title: Lense issue
customer_reviews.text: The Lense opened and then would not shut while on a trip. I did more research and it turns out to be a reucurring problem with this camera. Specificly the problem happens with the camera having a serial number between a certain set of numbers. My Camera's serial number did not fall in those numbers and it still had the problem. So I return the camera to Amazon and they have been great so far. The camera just did not preform the way i expected from a camera of this price and reputaion.
customer_reviews.author: Steven W Richardson

customer_reviews.title: ... went with this camera and I have not been disappointed. I wanted the large sensor similar to a ...
customer_reviews.text: After doing a ton of research I went with this camera and I have not been disappointed. I wanted the large sensor similar to a DSLR with a more point and shoot format. Highly recommend this over other models with interchangeable lenses. If you look this models often have smaller sensors. The big sensors give you a bigger file that is better to edit in photoshop.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Jackson Junior

customer_reviews.title: Takes fine photos, until it doesn't
customer_reviews.text: I've had the camera for about two years, and it takes fine photos. About a month ago, the shutter release stopped working. Over on the Canon forums there are 41 pages of people who have cameras that won't take pictures. Canon says that there is no issue and wants $160 to look at it. Feel free to buy this, just remember to add in the repair costs.
customer_reviews.author: cap peterson

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement for my S 90
customer_reviews.text: Am quite satisfied with the performance of this camera and it's ease of use. Pictures are clear and well pronounced. Was skeptical after reading some reviews of "lens error" problems but was relieved when I started using the camera. Great for travel and easy to carry. Plus the full array of manual settings.
customer_reviews.author: Murray G. Saunders

customer_reviews.title: Decent for underwater only
customer_reviews.text: Takes better pictures under water than it does on land. Doesn't handle low light or fast motion well. Got it because I'd heard it was a good dive camera, and with the proper lighting I've found this to be true. Wouldn't buy it again, but satisfactory enough to keep and use it.
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: Loved the Camera at first
customer_reviews.text: Loved the Camera at first, but then I received a Lens Error when I was on vacation. Sent it in for repair and after a week it was returned back to me. Then about 9 months later I got the error again; only this time it wasn't covered under warranty. Camera took great pictures when it was working, but not worth fixing. I had other Cannons in the past and never had issues like this.
customer_reviews.author: Rick B

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: We upgraded from the ELPH when we were going to Iceland on vacation. The camera takes amazing photos! Truly professional quality. And all I used was the point and click as I didn't have time to read up on all the camera abilities. And it fits in your pocket- minimal lugging.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy

customer_reviews.title: Canon makes the best!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera is great!! I can't say enough good things about the camera and the software. This camera is realiable and just great. Any camera from Canon is great and this S100 replaced an old Canon that we had for many, many years. Buy, you'll love it. Easy to use, easy to share and easy to transfer pictures with the software.
customer_reviews.author: James Hayden

customer_reviews.title: Canon Power Shot 100
customer_reviews.text: Until received, I didn't know what a great choice I made. For its size, features are seemingly endless, but not intimidating. Most importantly, the photos are stunningly produced. Pop up flash was a bit awkward, at first, but with time one adapts to it. Compared to list price, I don't think I could not have done better. Don't use my SLR as ,much as I used to. The S100 is so convenient ... wherever I go, it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B Cool

customer_reviews.title: Two Thumbs up
customer_reviews.text: Awesome camera...great image quality for such a small camera fits in front pocket..video is pretty good also..I have taped many concerts and am always surprised and pleased with the results. Do not compare this to a 5D MkIII.....having said that I would buy again for sure
customer_reviews.author: P McD96

customer_reviews.title: so much in such a little package
customer_reviews.text: I ask a friend whom I consider a pretty fine photographer to recommended a point and shoot, she immediately showed me her S100. I bought one on Amazon and I'm happy with my purchase.The image stabilization of this little camera is great. I'm still learning what the camera can do, but all my friends oouuued and aahed looking at my latest holiday pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Lyn Moelich

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I loved my S100 for the time I had it. I'm a pro photog and needed a carry all the time camera. It actually performs very well even @ 1600 ISO. I owned each S model from the S90 to this one. I only sold it to get a Lumix LX7 which I like a lot more but is not as compact as this one. I woulda kept both if I didn't need the money to pay for the LX7.
customer_reviews.author: Angel E. Valentin

customer_reviews.title: the best pocket digicam out there
customer_reviews.text: Of the pocket digicams available, I like the level of control over the shot the S100 provides and I especially like the available F2.0 apperture at the wide angle (24mm). additionally, for its size, it has a larger than typical sensor which aids low light work. of course, with the S100, one can enjoy full automatic photograpy. With this camera, it is best to stick with snap shots and landscapes, leaving the action shots for your SLR. I have not yet utilized its motion picture capabilites as I consider it primarily my pocket still camera. I have had lots of fun playing with my S100 now for almost two months and carry it everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: george watchinsky

customer_reviews.title: Lens broken/Malfunction after one year use ...
customer_reviews.text: I love everything about the camera, fully satiisfed with it ... the only thing is that lens had in issue it was anounced by canon that its manufacturer defect. I had send for service, however, support here in the middle east sucks I was told to wait over a month for parts to arrive from Japan .... all in all this camera is one that wont regret buying if you are not looking for ZOOM cameras.
customer_reviews.author: adel

customer_reviews.title: Glad that I bought it!
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't justify the price, at first, but I had Canon PowerShot (I think it was 880) before that my wife broke and was looking for a dissent replacement. I tested Nikon and Panasonic with similar features, and couldn't get used to them. I love the zoom wheel on the front; looks like you are a professional photographer. Very easy to use and the pictures are bright and sharp looking. I do recommend this product to anyone looking for upper quality and ease of use point-and-shoot camera.
customer_reviews.author: branmace

customer_reviews.title: I Went Cruising with my Canon PowerShot Camera
customer_reviews.text: I used my camera for the first time on my Caribbean Cruise. It took great pictures and video. It was very easy to set up the program to view and download my pictures to my computer. I love the size also. It fit easily in my pocketbook for quick access. I would definitely recommend it to family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Ronswife

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: I have a heavy camera that I don't take out to family gatherings because I don't want to look like the official photographer, but this camera does all that a regular DSLR camera can (well almost all) and its small and compact. The only issue is the battery runs out fast, so you will either need to carry two and/or carry your charger with you. Also, you have to remember that the flash comes out on the left side, but after you get used to it, it all works out fine.
customer_reviews.author: Marin Trujillo

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Camera stopped working shortly after purchase. I was in a hot and humid climate on vacation and that is the only reason I can think for why it stopped functioning properly, but regardless it should not be an issue. Disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Trisha

customer_reviews.title: Great basic camera for travel, family pics
customer_reviews.text: Had this camera for 2 years now. I love the sharpness of the lens, the low light capability and the very wide angle on the bottom end of the zoom. Very comfortable to store in pants pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Lockean

customer_reviews.title: What an awewsome dive camera!!!
customer_reviews.text: This camera exceeded the quality I was expecting for a camera priced at this amount. The dive was in 38 degree water and I filmed for a constant 23 minutes before the battery told me I needed to take a break. I took another 44 pics after shutting of the video and after the dive, I was able to preview all the video and pics on the same battery!!! I cannot complain about anything on this camera, it performed better than I could have ever expected.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce V Gray

customer_reviews.title: Very good camera for the size
customer_reviews.text: I wanted a small camera with good photo and video quality, this is it. The good: Small Good photo and video quality A lot of features including HDR Good and fast pictures in the dark The bad: Battery life could be better. (I recommend to bay a second battery) Flash pop up: the flash pops up where we usually put our finger. (will be good to have it at the middle of the camera instead of left) Good product
customer_reviews.author: Jorge Luis Alvarez

customer_reviews.title: This is a good camera! Pics are awesome
customer_reviews.text: This is a good camera! Pics are awesome! I'll buy another used one before I buy a newer model of any brand!
customer_reviews.author: PA

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Pictures and Features
customer_reviews.text: This slim camera takes great pictures specially in dark environments. the function of ring (around the lens) is another great feature. Generally, quality of images are great, however, I wish it had a super zoom lens. I highly recommend this product, if you don't have problem to pay more than $300.
customer_reviews.author: Ehsan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality Camera!
customer_reviews.text: The Quality and Specifications of this camera is excellent! For professionals like me, the ability to shoot in RAW format is a good option. I rate this camera 4 instead of 5 due to the LCD has a little green tint. According to some forums, that happens with some of this cameras, but not all. The quality of the final images is not affected.
customer_reviews.author: Noel Del Pilar

customer_reviews.title: Great compact camera!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this over and above the S110, as it has the GPS feature, which the S110 does not. A wider zoom would have been preferred, but typically wide zooms are at the sacrifice of image quality. A great pocket camera for those interested in the robust feature set akin to a DLSR, including shooting RAW.
customer_reviews.author: nuke

customer_reviews.title: Nice camera.
customer_reviews.text: Love, love, love this camera. We bought it second hand. The battery life is a bit low. Other than that it's amazing. Takes wonderful photos of the sky (clouds, moon, sunsets. I imagine sunrises as well, but we are never up that early). I am a lay person with a camera, and many of my lay-person friends have admired the photos and asked what camera I am using. Love this camera.
customer_reviews.author: Libby V Hanley

customer_reviews.title: I like it but...
customer_reviews.text: In the first few months of using it we have had occasional lens errors which were corrected by removing the battery. However, after around 7-8 months of using it, the lens got stocked open and the camera powers off on startup. We have sent the camera for repairs to Cannon and they have fixed the issues. Let’s hope it will last. Also, the GPS works very poorly and this was one of the main reasons for upgrading from the S95 to S100. Overall, it is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: vasilica

customer_reviews.title: Great Camera - Excellent value for the money
customer_reviews.text: This is my handy-camera when I do not want to carry my DSLR around. I was amazed at the control and functions provided by this camera. The pictures are great when light is good. The pictures aren't too bad indoors as well as long as you have decent light. The camera is very light weight yet very customizable. I really enjoy using this camera.
customer_reviews.author: I_luv_gadgets

customer_reviews.title: Performs as well as expected
customer_reviews.text: Overall I'm mostly happy - it works with only minor usability niggles, ISO6400 is usable, and optical quality is quite good. Battery life is weak, as expected. Bear in mind that, as a video camera, it's not great - it'll randomly stop recording after around 22 min, and at best recording times are limited to less than 30min. Unlike my FT1, you can't set this camera up to record an event without a minder - it's ok for clips, but that's it. Battery life for taking video is around 82 minutes. (Also, video ISO is limited to 1600.)
customer_reviews.author: Theuns Verwoerd

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: I own the Canon S95 and purchased this model for my mother. It has all the features of the S95 that I like (RAW format shooting, Usable Manual mode & dials that allow adjusting of ISO/F-Stop easily) The only con I have so far is battery life, the GPS feature seems to really eat away at the battery life so unless you're using it for hiking or geo-caching I'd leave it off as it significantly affects battery life.
customer_reviews.author: warhammerjunkeee

customer_reviews.title: Best pocket camera.
customer_reviews.text: I use a Canon t4i as my main camera, but sometimes you need to go places where its not feasible to carry a large camera. This is a great camera small enough to fit in my pocket when I don't want a big camera to carry around.
customer_reviews.author: Skippy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Pocket Camera
customer_reviews.text: This is a great quality small camera that can easily be stowed in a pocket or purse. Great optics for the size, shoots raw and jpeg. The LCD is large and bright and seems to have very accurate color. The photos I get from this are not as good as the photos I get from my DSLR but then I would not expect them to be. All-in-all this camera exceeds my expectations and is a camera I would carry on vacation or around town for quick photo oportuntieis.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald D. Lykins

customer_reviews.title: Great camera
customer_reviews.text: Bought this camera on black Friday 9 months ago and it has worked great so far taking a few thousand pictures and videos. The camera does VERY well in low light conditions for being a fit-in-your-pocket camera. The GPS feature works OK, it does drain the battery faster though.
customer_reviews.author: Marko

customer_reviews.title: This camera takes great pictures.
customer_reviews.text: This camera takes great pictures... when its working! The shutter release stopped working and the camera is useless. I searched online for solutions and found out that tons of people are experiencing the same issue. If your warranty is over you'll have to pay ~$160 :(
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The item arrived timely and as advertised. The camera ...
customer_reviews.text: The item arrived timely and as advertised. The camera developed a shutter problem, and only after I had agreed to a $175 fix it charge did Canon advise that the problem was systemic and the charge was dropped. I consider Canon's behavior duplicitous.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth S. Hempel

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA
customer_reviews.text: This camera is notorious for lens errors. Mine is broken and Canon is trying to charge me to fix it even though it is a KNOWN error. My camera is still even under warranty. DO NOT BUY THIS MODEL.
customer_reviews.author: mdemino

customer_reviews.title: Great camera that takes high quality pictures.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a small camera that I could carry in my purse for short trips and one that would take a high quality picture and this camera provided that for me. It is easy to hold and filled my requirements. I have received many compliments on the pictures I have taken.
customer_reviews.author: sunshine

customer_reviews.title: Great for enthusiastic amateur
customer_reviews.text: The minus is that the battery isn't that good--I've found it needs recharging after a day and a half of use or about 50-60 snaps. So buy a second battery!! Other than that I like the camera very much--it does all I need and does it well, quickly and simply.
customer_reviews.author: J. Palmer

product_meta.title: Canon PowerShot S100 12.1 MP Digital Camera with 5x Wide Angle Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)
product_meta.description:
Color:Silver| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingPowerShot FS100 Digital Camera (Silver) What's in the Box: PowerShot S100 Body, Battery Pack NB-5L, Battery Charger CB-2LX, Wrist Strap WS-DC11, USB Interface Cable IFC-400PCU, Digital Camera Solution CD-ROM

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 ELPH S100 Sleek and Serious

The PowerShot S100 is a sophisticated pocket-friendly point-and-shoot digital camera that has the power advanced users and enthusiasts need to create standout images. As with other PowerShot cameras, the compact PowerShot S100 incorporates all of the advanced Canon technologies that make capturing superb photos and video as easy as pressing a button. As automatic or manual as you need it to be, the PowerShot S100 is a serious photographic tool, which incorporates the Canon HS SYSTEM, now featuring the new DIGIC 5 Image Processor. The fast f/2.0 lens helps you tackle unfavorable lighting and capture breathtaking portraits with beautiful, shallow depth-of-field. 12.1 Megapixels ensure crisp, richly detailed images, and a 5x Optical Zoom provides an excellent all-around range to shoot near or far. 


Experience the Power 

Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor



The latest-generation Canon DIGIC 5 Image Processor brings phenomenal increases in processing speed and power. Improved chip architecture and algorithms deliver greatly expanded functionality with further refinement in image quality. 
Improved noise reduction produces clearer images when shooting in low light at high ISO speeds. Enhanced i-Contrast performance adjusts differences between light and dark areas to achieve even more natural-looking results. 
The faster processing speed also results in faster continuous shooting capability while maintaining full image quality. The DIGIC 5 Image Processor also makes possible a new, highly advanced automatic white balance system. Whereas conventional white balance makes an overall adjustment based on a single type of light source, the new Canon Multi-Area White Balance analyzes several areas of the image to determine whether different adjustments are needed, for example, for the main subject and the background. 
Noise Reduction
Conventional Image Processor
White Balance
With DIGIC 5 Image Processor


Canon CMOS Sensor

The PowerShot S100 digital camera employs a new Canon 12.1 Megapixel CMOS sensor. Inheriting much of the advanced technology developed for Canon EOS DSLR cameras, this sensor delivers state-of-the-art imaging performance and is optimized for use in compact cameras, such as the PowerShot S100. Utilizing a sophisticated light-capturing design, it provides high sensitivity for improved high ISO capture without increased noise. It is also a high-speed design, capable of rapidly capturing and moving image data to the processor, enabling faster continuous shooting and faster autofocus.


Canon HS SYSTEM

 The Canon HS SYSTEM lets you take bright, clear photos in an even wider range of shooting situations. Beautiful low-light shots are possible with minimal noise and maximum detail in highlight and shadow areas. The system is the result of two technologies brought together in PowerShot cameras: a high-sensitivity imaging sensor, which is able to capture more light; and the DIGIC Image Processor, which actively reduces noise with high-speed image processing. The 12.1 Megapixel Canon CMOS sensor in the PowerShot S100 incorporates advanced light reception technology that enhances sensitivity. The new DIGIC 5 Image Processor provides a major boost in noise reduction, expanding the usable ISO range to an amazing high of ISO 6400. The Canon HS SYSTEM thus lets you use higher shutter speeds to capture clearer images with reduced noise and blur.



Memorable Moments in Spectacular FULL HD
 In addition to the Canon HS SYSTEM, the combination of the advanced CMOS sensor and DIGIC 5 Image Processor in the PowerShot S100 makes it possible to shoot crisp, clear high definition video. Imagine the fun and excitement of being able to shoot spectacular 1080p Full HD video with stereo sound that you can later watch on your HDTV or download to your computer to share with family and friends. In addition to being able to shoot Full HD 1080p video at 24* frames per second, the PowerShot S100 can also shoot 720p HD video at 30** frames per second.


 

HDTV Playback via HDMI with CEC Support 
 

 

 

 

 It's easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot S100. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable. And because the PowerShot S100 supports HDMI-CEC technology, youíll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TVís remote control. (CEC ñ Consumer Electronic Control ñ is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)



iFrame Movie Support 


 

 

It’s easy to enjoy and share the videos you shoot with the PowerShot S100. Simply connect its HDMI terminal to your HDTV using an HDMI cable (included). And because the PowerShot S100 supports HDMI-CEC technology, you’ll be able to control the playback of your images and videos on any CEC-enabled HDTV using the TV’s remote control. (CEC – Consumer Electronic Control – is part of the HDMI specification, enabling components in a system to communicate with one another.)



Experience the Power


Full range of Shooting and Recording Modes Including RAW + JPEG


The PowerShot S100 lets you shoot in RAW mode, which captures images that are uncompressed and essentially unprocessed by the camera. Often the choice of advanced photographers, RAW images can be processed in your computer using Canon DPP (Digital Photo Professional) or other compatible third-party software. Creative control is completely in your hands as you adjust a wide range of variables to produce exactly the final image you want. The camera can also be set to allow the simultaneous recording of both RAW and JPEG images while shooting.

 

Control Ring 

Focus, Exposure, ISO, Step Zoom, or White Balance can now be adjusted more quickly and conveniently with the PowerShot S100’s control ring. Located at the base of the lens barrel, the ring is more intuitive than other types of controls for many experienced photographers. The functions that can be assigned to the control ring vary with shooting mode, and you can set your preferences quickly using the dedicated ring function selector button.

GPS Technology 
 The PowerShot S100 digital camera is equipped with Global Positioning System (GPS)* technology. Now you can travel the world and let the camera automatically record the locations and local times of your stills and videos. The camera can also use the GPS unit to automatically set the exact time. You can maximize the usefulness of the GPS feature by using the special bundled Map Utility software that makes it fun to share the memories of your world adventures. In addition to displaying all your photos’ locations on a world map, the camera’s GPS system can also track your route from photo to photo – a great way to visualize each trip! You can also create and share custom maps and personal mini-travel guides with friends and family members.



A Steady Image is a Beautiful Image

Intelligent IS

The latest advance in Canon Optical Image Stabilization technology, Intelligent IS analyzes camera movement and applies the best shake correction method for the shooting situation. For stills, the system automatically selects among Normal, Panning, Macro (Hybrid) and Tripod IS modes. When shooting video, the system automatically selects among Dynamic, Powered, Macro and Tripod IS modes. With Intelligent IS, you can concentrate on image capture, letting the camera make the most effective IS settings to assure the steadiest possible image.
Normal
Corrects for a wide range of camera movement when shooting stills. Panning
Panning motion is detected so that IS does not interfere with desired camera movement. Hybrid
Corrects for shift-type camera shake, which typically occurs in macro (close-up) shooting. Dynamic
Effective for video shooting at wide-angle focal lengths, eliminating the unwanted shaking that typically occurs while walking. Powered
Compensates for hand movement when shooting video at the telephoto end of the zoom range, where camera shake is magnified. Tripod
When tripod use is detected, the Image Stabilizer is stopped because it is not needed. 
Shooting Modes/Special Scene Modes
Custom Define and store your own settings to achieve the effects you prefer.
Manual
You have complete control of exposure, selecting both aperture and shutter speed manually.
Aperture-Priority
You set the aperture, controlling depth-of-field. The camera automatically selects the shutter speed. Shutter-Priority You select the shutter speed to stop or blur action, and the camera finds the appropriate aperture. With slow exposure times, Canon's noise reduction system activates to ensure low image noise.
Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Smart AUTO
The camera automatically selects the best shooting settings for optimal quality based on subjects and environmental factors to provide point-and-shoot simplicity.
Movie Digest Records a video clip before capturing a still image and then combines one day’s worth of clips into a video. Portrait The camera sets a large aperture, focusing the subject and artistically blurring the background to make your subject “pop.” Kids & Pets Reduced focusing time freezes fast-moving subjects, so you won't miss those special shots. Landscape
Increases depth-of-field for sharp and sweeping landscape shots.
Smart Shutter The camera automatically takes the photo when people smile, wink, or get into frame. High-Speed Burst HQ Capture fast-action shots at full sensor resolution, by shooting continuously when the shutter button is held down.
Handheld Night Scene Take clear and steady pictures at night without the use of a tripod.
Beach Beach Get clear shots of people at a sunny beach without darkened faces. Underwater Capture underwater images with reduced backscatter effect. Optional Underwater Case required.
Foliage
Capture brilliant shots of autumn foliage, greenery and blossoms.
Snow Shoot clear snow scenes without darkened subjects or an unnatural bluish tint.
Fireworks Grab brilliant images of skyrocketing fireworks. Stitch Assist
Easy-to-use guidelines simplify the shooting of aligned multiple frames that can later be combined (using bundled software) to create panoramic photos.
Creative Filters
This setting provides easy access to special filter effects and scene modes, such as Toy Camera Effect, Poster Effect, Monochrome and more. 
High Dynamic Range
The camera combines three different exposures to get one evenly lit image.
Super Slow Motion Movie Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
Program Access advanced exposure compensation features while shooting mostly automatically.
Fisheye Effect Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Nostalgic
Create the look and feel of old photographs using sepia tones and black-and-white.
Fisheye Effect
Add a classic photo distortion without a fisheye lens.
Miniature Effect for Movies & Stills Emphasizes perspectives for a miniature effect by blurring upper and bottom portions of the image. Toy Camera Effect Simulates photos taken with "toy" or pinhole cameras, darkening the image at the edges to create a vignette effect. Poster Effect Poster Effect combines several similar shades into one color, turning subtle gradations into eye-catching, scene-popping contrasts. Monochrome Choose from three single-tone effects: Black-and-White, Sepia, or Blue. Super Vivid
Super Vivid intensifies existing hues, saturating the scene with bright colors. Color Accent Choose to retain a single color in your image while other colors turn monochrome. Color Swap Select a color and replace it with a color you specify for special effects. Movie The camera takes five photos in succession, and then chooses the best one out of the bunch.
Super Slow Motion Movie
Record your clips in high speed (approx. 240 fps), and then watch your videos in slow motion.
iFrame Movie The Apple® movie format, iFrame, makes it easier and quicker to import and upload videos while retaining high image quality.
feature_bullets: 3-inch TFT color LCD with wide viewing angle
Full 1080p HD video with stereo sound
24mm wide-angle lens (5x optical zoom, 4x digital zoom and 20x combined zoom) with optical image stabilizer

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.0 out of 5 stars800 ratings4.0 out of 5 stars
